qas.question: When did many newer churches start growing in Nigeria?
What is the largest Anglican church in Nigeria?

answers.text: the Church of Nigeria of the Anglican Communion

qas.question: What is the largest Baptist church in Nigeria?

context: Leading Protestant churches in the country include <a1_0>the Church of Nigeria of the Anglican Communion<a1_0/>, the Assemblies of God Church, <a2_0>the Nigerian Baptist Convention<a2_0/> and The Synagogue, Church Of All Nations <a0_0>Since the 1990s<a0_0/>, there has been significant growth in many other churches, particularly the evangelical Protestant ones. These include the Redeemed Christian Church of God, Winners' Chapel, Christ Apostolic Church (the first Aladura Movement in Nigeria), Deeper Christian Life Ministry, Evangelical Church of West Africa, Mountain of Fire and Miracles, Christ Embassy and The Synagogue Church Of All Nations. In addition, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, the Aladura Church, the Seventh-day Adventist and various indigenous churches have also experienced growth.
